hints.content:
We need to know the number of times the second string waved.

![A tape diagram models that the 330 times the first string waved and 257 more times are equal to an unknown number of times the second string waved.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3ff883db62944900bb5cd1284b6834926ca1a90b)

$\maroonD{330}+\blueE{257} = \purpleD{?}$

$\begin{align}
\maroonD{330}+\blueE{257} &=\maroonD{300}+\blueE{200} + \maroonD{30} + \blueE{50} + \maroonD{0} + \blueE{7} \\\\
&= 500 + 80 +7
\\\\
&=\purpleD{587}
\end{align}$

![Part 1 of 2. Place value blocks show 3 hundreds plus 2 hundreds plus 3 tens plus 5 tens plus 0 plus 7](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b4744bf91899cd15ce045ec9b4bd02b8459b7d12)

![Part 2 of 2 of previous image.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e9c58d14bf2fd7f8efb3459dcb227c8ca736ca4e)

question.content:
Aria played two strings on her guitar. The first string waved $330$ times and the second string waved $257$ more times than the first string.

**How many times did the second string wave?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] times
